item.title: Mackerel Salad
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2 fairly generously. Best if potatoes cooked well in advance. 240g smoked mackerel200g new potatoes, quartered and steamed or boiledSalad leaves Juice of 1 lemon1 tbsp olive oil1 tsp wholegrain mustard1 tsp maple syrup, optionalSalt Prepare dressing: mix lemon juice olive oil, mustard, salt, and maple syrup if using. Shake vigorously to emulsify. Scatter […]

item.title: Frozen Pea Soup
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2 250g frozen peas250ml Marigold vegetable stockOptional 10 mint leaves from the garden½ tbsp basil olive oil Cook peas in the stock. Add mint leaves if available. Liquidise. Add oil, stir in, serve.

item.title: 15-Minute Stir Fry
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: This recipe is delicious, quick and incredibly flexible, and will cause complete chaos in your kitchen. The original recipe is on page 298 of Good Housekeeping’s New (sic) Step-By-Step Cookbook. Ingredients Oil, 1 tbsp p.p. Cashews, a handful. Feel free to use extra since you will be snacking on them during the later stages of cooking. […]

item.title: Apple Chicken Salad
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Lunch mix for one. Based on: http://www.lecremedelacrumb.com/2015/01/fuji-apple-chicken-salad-panera-bread-copycat.html 1 chicken breast, cooked, chopped lettucepecan halvesgorgonzolaapple chipsapple salad dressing (olive oil, apple cider vinegar, mustard, apple juice)
